intro: Pseudocayratia orientalisinensis, commonly known as the oriental false cayratia, is a climbing vine native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has been studied for its potential medicinal properties due to the presence of various bioactive compounds.
